subject: Mental Health
title: Trauma vs. Stress
description: A 60-second lesson on Trauma vs. Stress.

hook.text: Stress bends you. Trauma breaks something that doesn't snap back.

buildup.text: Stress is a normal response to pressure that resolves when the pressure lifts.

discovery.text: Trauma creates a lasting change in the brain's threat detection system.

twist.text: You can be stressed about a deadline; you're traumatized when the world feels unsafe.

climax.text: The key difference is whether normal functioning returns after the event ends.

punchline.text: Stress passes. Trauma rewrites the operating system.

quiz.question: What distinguishes trauma from ordinary stress?
options: Trauma creates lasting changes in the brain's threat system
Stress is always worse than trauma
